Package Core

Class Field

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
Core.Field
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public class Field extends JPanel
Graphical User Interface that converts the provided Sprites to a graphical representation as a Pixel Field. This class also provides methods to manipulate that board and set how the graphics are displayed.
Version:
0.4
Author:
Marc Albareda
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • background

      public String background
      Path to Background. Null for no background.

    • moveOutOfScroll

      public boolean moveOutOfScroll
      Checks whether the objects out of scrolls should continue moving Caution: enabling this will destroy the performance

    • updateOutOfScroll

      public boolean updateOutOfScroll
      Checks whether the objects out of scrolls should continue updating. False will improve performacne

    • lockScroll

      public boolean lockScroll
      Checks whether the scroll is locked to an object

      Checks whether the scroll is locked to an object on the Y axis

      public boolean lockScrollX
      Checks whether the scroll is locked to an object on the X axis

    • cl

      Redraws field if window size is changed.

      public void addSprite(Sprite s)

      public void draw(ArrayList<Sprite> ssprites)
      Draws the provided sprite list, and nothing else

    • scroll

      public void scroll(int x, int y)
      Scrolls the whole field by the specified ammount
      Parameters:
      x - The ammount of pixels it should be horizontally scrolled (negative left, positive right)
      y - The ammount of pixels it should be vertically scrolled (negative up, positive down)

    • resetScroll

      public void resetScroll()
      Resets the scroll, being returned at 0,0

    • lockScroll

      public void lockScroll(Sprite s, Window w)
      locks the scroll to a sprite
      Parameters:
      s -

    • lockScroll

      public void lockScroll(Sprite s, Window w, boolean x, boolean y)
      locks the scroll to a sprite on the selected axis (X or Y)
      Parameters:
      s - Sprite on which the scroll will be locked
      w - Window that will be locked
      x - whether the X axis will be locked or not
      y - whether the Y axis will be locked or not

    • lineCast

      public Sprite lineCast(int xO, int yO, int xD, int yD, HashSet<Integer> ignoredLayers)
      Throws a linecast from the origin point to the destination point. The Linecast draws a line from those two points and returns the first sprite in the path of that line
      Parameters:
      xO - x coordinate of the Origin point
      yO - y coordinate of the Origin point
      xD - x coordinate of the Destination point. Also xD
      yD - y coordinate of the Destination point.
      ignoredLayers - HashSet containing the integers of every layer that should be ignored
      Returns:
      the first sprite that the ray collides with. Null if it reaches the destination point without colliding with anyone

    • lineCast

      public Sprite lineCast(Sprite origin, int xD, int yD)
      Throws a linecast from center of the sprite to the destination point. The Linecast draws a line from those two points and returns the first sprite in the path of that line, excluding the ones on the layer of the sprite that has thrown it
      Parameters:
      origin - Sprite from where the line is cast
      xD - x coordinate of the Destination point. Also xD
      yD - y coordinate of the Destination point.
      Returns:
      the first sprite (excluding the ones in the same layer as the origin sprite) that the ray collides with. Null if it reaches the destination point without colliding with anyone

    • swapColors

      public BufferedImage swapColors(BufferedImage img, Color... mapping)
      swaps colors
      Parameters:
      img -
      an - array of colors. Even numbers would be the ones being replaced by the inmediately successive numbers
      Returns:
